文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk1
证据片段: Specimens of Zircaloy-2 have been exposed at 240°C (464°F) in various locations in the primary circuit of the Halden Boiling Water Reactor (HBWR)

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk1
证据片段: corrosion rates increased a hundred times, and was under normal conditions about 0.15 mg/dm² per day for pickled, anodized, and autoclaved material

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk1
证据片段: Variations in the flux level from 2×10⁹ to 3×10¹² neutrons/cm²·s (>1 MeV) had little influence on the corrosion rate

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk1
证据片段: When uranium was present in the water, the corrosion rate increased for pickled and for autoclaved fuel rods, while hardly any effect was observed with anodized material

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk1
证据片段: A deliberate fluoride contamination on the specimens increased the corrosion rate in-pile as well as out-of-pile

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk1
证据片段: By anodizing this harmful effect of fluorides could be completely counteracted

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk1
证据片段: All specimens of Zircaloy-2 were first pickled in a hydrofluoric-nitric acid mixture

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk1
证据片段: Autoclaving was normally carried out for three days in steam at 400°C (752°F) and 50 kp/cm² (4.9 MPa)

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk1
证据片段: The anodizing was done by using an aqueous electrolyte containing 0.5 percent potassium hydroxide (KOH)

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk1
证据片段: the acid concentration was adjusted to give an average contamination of ~5 μg fluorine/cm²

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk1
证据片段: The vapor contaminated specimens had surface concentrations of 5 to 10 μg fluorine/cm²

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk1
证据片段: A. Reactor core, fuel pins, 240 ± 2°C, 0.04 ppm Oxygen, 0.01 ppm Deuterium, 3×10¹²-5×10¹² n/cm²·s fast flux

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk1
证据片段: B. Reactor core in a fuel assembly, unfuelled tubes, 240 ± 2°C, 0.04 ppm Oxygen, 0.01 ppm Deuterium, ~10¹² n/cm²·s fast flux

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk1
证据片段: C. Water phase near to tank wall, unfuelled coupons, 240 ±2°C, 0.03 ppm Oxygen, 0.01 ppm Deuterium, 2×10⁹-2×10¹⁰ n/cm²·s fast flux

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: According to Burns, a flux level of $1 0 ^ { 1 1 } \mathrm { n } / \mathrm { c m } ^ { 2 } { \cdot } \mathrm { s }$ was required to give any significant effect at $2 8 0 ^ { \circ } C \ ( 5 3 6 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { F } )

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: our results are still surprising considering the large effect of the much lower flux, $2 \times 1 0 ^ { 9 } \mathrm { n / c m } ^ { 2 } { \cdot } \mathrm { s }$

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: Shepherd has made a tentative calculation of the in-reactor corrosion rate under oxygenated conditions as a function of the temperature, and predicts a rate at $2 4 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ EY $( 4 6 4 ^ { \circ } \mathsf { F } )$ which fits exactly with our observations

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: His data are normalized to a standard fast flux of $3 \times 1 0 ^ { 1 3 } \mathrm { n / c m ^ { 2 } { \cdot } s }

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: the data indicate that saturation has occurred already at a flux level of $2 \times 1 0 ^ { 9 } \mathrm { { n } / \mathrm { { \ell } } }$ $\mathsf { c m } ^ { 2 } { \cdot } \mathsf { s }$ at ${ 2 4 0 ^ { \circ } C }$

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: The axial flux variation in the fuel channel was observed to influence the corrosion rate both for fuel rods and specimens, the difference being small $( \sim 1 0$ percent) but significant

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: tests in steam with γ irradiation $( 6 \times 1 0 ^ { 6 } \mathrm { R / h } )$ EY did not result in any significant effect on the corrosion rate

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: The irradiation field in the steam phase gave a much lower corrosion rate than that in the water at approximately the same flux, the rate being slightly higher than in water out-of-flux

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: The corrosion rate observed for the out-of-flux specimens agree well with other low-temperature data

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: During the 690-day exposure a series of cracks developed in the oxide films of the autoclaved specimens

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk3
证据片段: No cracks were observed on the pickled and the anodized specimens

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk4
证据片段: Out-of-pile and in-pile corrosion rates in absence of heat flux are nearly unaffected by an autoclaving or anodizing pretreatment

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_042_chunk5
证据片段: Figure showing corrosion behavior
